intro: Codonanthe hookeri f. oblongifolia, commonly known as the oblong-leaved codonanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its lanceolate to oblong leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink to red, which are often borne in clusters at the leaf axils. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
